conclusion: Analyze the flow path of the liquid from each entry point (A, B, C, and D) to the containers.
A, B, C, and D are the entry points where the liquid flows in.
The liquid from A flows downward and encounters the first baffle.
The liquid from A is directed towards the left side.
The liquid from A continues downward and enters container E.
The liquid from B flows downward and encounters the first baffle.
The liquid from B is directed towards the right side.
The liquid from B continues downward and enters container F.
The liquid from C flows downward and encounters the first baffle.
The liquid from C is directed towards the left side.
The liquid from C continues downward and enters container E.
The liquid from D flows downward and encounters the first baffle.
The liquid from D is directed towards the right side.
The liquid from D continues downward and enters container F.
Liquids from entry points A and C flow into container E.
Liquids from entry points B and D flow into container F.
Container E will receive liquid from entry points A and C.
Container F will receive liquid from entry points B and D.
